reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: British Council - Philippines - Newton Fund

description.narrative: The Newton Fund uses science and innovation partnerships to promote economic development and social welfare of partner countries.

The Newton Fund's primary objective is to reduce poverty by generating and putting into use knowledge and technology to address development challenges and advance development for the poorest people and countries. We will seek to maximise the practical impact of research and innovation to improve the lives and opportunities of the global poor. In achieving this we will grow the research and innovation capacity of developing countries, as well as contributing to the continued strength of the UK’s research and innovation system, and support our wider prosperity and global influence.

title.narrative: Newton Skills Event February 2016

description.narrative: Future national partner Technical Education and Skills Development Authority (TESDA) co-funded Newton Fund to attend Science Technology Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) Skills Event in Belfast; future collaboration for Technical Vocational Education and Training (TVET) Programme anticipated starting 2016/17

• To increase pipeline of talent, particularly for technical roles (laboratory, engineering, environmental, or forensic technicians for example), and ensuring that future labour market needs can be met

title.narrative: Professional Development and Engagement (PDE) - 2019 - Research Translation - Transformative Innovation Policy Framework Phase 1

description.narrative: Workshop on Transformative Innovation Policy framework for DOST research councils, targeting policy and grant managers and officers; including development of case studies of TI in the Philippines

• Multi-phase program to deliver professional development researchers and/or workers in science and innovation, introducing Transformative Innovation Policy framework to DOST research councils and its potential adoption in developing STI policies • Expected to be followed by a capacity building program/workshops in 2020/2021
